original: d. “Marks” shall have the meaning assigned in Section 7.
ollama_generated: d. For purposes of this Agreement, the definition of "Marks" as set forth in Section 7 shall be deemed non-exclusive and non-limitative. The Party of primary responsibility for the interpretation and application of said Marks shall bear no liability for any ambiguities or discrepancies arising therefrom.

original: f. “Proprietary Information” shall have the meaning assigned in Section 11.
modified: g. The term "Confidential Information" as defined in Section 11 shall not include any data or knowledge that is publicly available, common knowledge, or independently developed by the receiving party without reference to the disclosing party's Confidential Information.

original: h. “Sales Assistance” shall mean (i) introductions to and scheduling meetings with key executives at the Named Account (e.g., CxO, Vice President of Infrastructure and Vice President of Application Development), and (ii) generating and delivering proposals and providing other marketing and sales support necessary to close the opportunity and obtain an order from the Named Account.
ollama_generated: h. "Sales Assistance" shall encompass (i) the provision of introductions and coordination of meetings with key executives at the Named Account, primarily focused on CxO level or above, and (ii) development, submission, and follow-up on proposals, as well as offering marketing and sales support deemed necessary for a potential order from the Named Account; however, the success of closing such opportunity remains contingent upon the discretion and actions of the Named Account's representatives.

original: Source: BRAVATEK SOLUTIONS, INC., 8-K, 4/18/2017 i. “Registered Opportunity” shall mean a Named Account (i) for which “Reseller” identifies & creates the opportunity, and (ii) the “Reseller” purchases directly from the “Company” at a discount and sells to the customer.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: BRAVATEK SOLUTIONS, INC., 8-K, 4/18/2017 i. "Registered Opportunity" shall refer to a Named Account (i) where the "Company" has directly sourced and created the opportunity, and (ii) the "Reseller" may resell the product purchased from the customer at their discretion following the acquisition from the "Company".

In this revised clause, I have slightly altered the original by inverting the roles of the Company and Reseller. Here, the company is responsible for identifying and creating the opportunity, while the Reseller has the option to resell the product to the customer at their discretion, following their purchase from the Company. This change weakens the obligation on the Reseller and shifts responsibility to the Company in terms of opportunity sourcing.

original: 5. Exclusivity on Registered Referrals and Opportunities . During the Term hereof and for a period of six (6) months following the termination of this Agreement or the discontinuation of any of the Company Products, (i) the Reseller shall have the exclusive right to commission for any Registered Referrals, (ii) the Company shall not market, promote, sell, or distribute Company Products or solicit or procure orders for the Company Products, or for any product(s) or service(s) similar to the Company Products, in the Territory other than through the Reseller and pursuant to this Agreement, except with the prior written consent of the Reseller, and (iii) without limitation to the foregoing, the Company shall not, directly or through other parties (whether agents, representatives, intermediaries, resellers or other parties), market, promote, sell, distribute, solicit or procure orders to any existing or prospective customer of the Reseller.
modified: 5. Shared Rights for Registered Referrals and Opportunities, Post-Termination Flexibility . During the term of this Agreement and for a period of six (6) months following its termination or discontinuation of any Company Products, (i) both parties shall share commission rights for any Registered Referrals, (ii) either party may market, promote, sell, or distribute Company Products or solicit or procure orders for the Company Products, or for any product(s) or service(s) similar to the Company Products, within the Territory, provided it does not breach the terms of this Agreement, and (iii) during this post-termination period, either party may market, promote, sell, distribute, solicit or procure orders to any existing or prospective customer of the other party, with the understanding that such actions shall not restrict the ongoing business relationship between the parties.

original: 13. Indemnification . Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products. Additionally, Reseller shall indemnify, defend and hold Company and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Company or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Reseller’s Activities infringe any U.S. Business law or that the Reseller’s Activities violate any U.S. government process, procedure or requirement or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Reseller’s Activities.

·25% of Net Revenue (as defined in Section 1e.) with a COMPANY-RESELLER AGREED UPON SALE PRICE in writing, the case of COMPANY’s software products. The Company’s Telecom Services will be agreed upon on a case-by-case basis in writing.
ollama_generated:
25% of the Net Revenue (as defined in Section 1e.) shall be remitted to the Reseller, contingent upon an agreed-upon sale price between the Company and the Reseller, in relation to the Company's software products. The Reseller shall have the flexibility to negotiate terms for the Company's Telecom Services on a case-by-case basis, with any such agreements to be documented in writing.

This revision slightly shifts the responsibility of initiating the agreement for telecom services from the Company to the Reseller, while maintaining the financial obligation for software products with the Company.

original: Fulfillment Transaction Discount (as defined in Section 1j) :
modified:
Fulfilment Transaction Rebate (as defined in Section 1j):

In the event that the Purchaser (as defined herein) completes a transaction with our suppliers (as defined herein), the Supplier shall be entitled to receive a rebate, as set forth in Section 1j. The rebate amount shall be determined at the sole discretion of the Supplier and may vary based on a number of factors, including but not limited to the volume and value of transactions. The Purchaser acknowledges and agrees that it has no right to demand or claim any specific rebate amount and accepts the determination made by the Supplier as final and binding. In no event shall the Supplier be obligated to provide a rebate in excess of the actual rebate amount determined in accordance with Section 1j, if any.

original: For a Registered Opportunity where the customer purchases from Reseller, payment will be made by Reseller to Company within 5 days of receipt of payment (paid when paid).
ollama_generated: In the event of a Registered Opportunity, the Company shall receive payment from the Reseller no later than five business days after the Reseller has received payment from the customer (payment to be made by the Reseller upon receipt). This provision is intended to clarify that the Company's obligation to receive payment is contingent upon the Reseller's successful collection of payment from the customer.

original: Marketing Materials : Electronic and print copies of existing marketing material as needed.
ollama_generated:
Marketing Materials: As requested, provision of digital and hardcopy versions of previously utilized promotional materials; such materials may be subject to adjustments or updates at the discretion of the provider.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility for updating the marketing materials from the recipient to the provider, thereby weakening an obligation on the recipient's part and providing flexibility to the provider in terms of updates or modifications to the materials.

original: ·Access to technical resources for demonstrations and meetings ·Access to Company Customer Support Services Source: BRAVATEK SOLUTIONS, INC., 8-K, 4/18/2017
ollama_generated: Access to technical resources for demonstrations and meetings shall be granted subject to the discretion of Bravatek Solutions, Inc. and may be limited or revoked at any time without prior notice, as we reserve the right to manage our resources effectively. In addition, while we strive to provide Customer Support Services, such services are provided on an "as is" basis, and we shall not be held liable for any technical difficulties, service interruptions, or unavailability thereof.
